intro: Melanodiscus oblongus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved waterplantain, is a perennial aquatic plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows in shallow freshwater environments such as ponds, streams, and wetlands. The plant has long, narrow leaves that are often submerged, with a dark green to bluish-green coloration. Its flowers are small and clustered in spikes, producing tiny, wind-pollinated blooms. Melanodiscus oblongus plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various invertebrates and fish.
